skill.name: code-review-excellence
skill.description: Master effective code review practices to provide constructive feedback, catch bugs early, and foster knowledge sharing while maintaining team morale. Use when reviewing pull requests, establishing review standards, or mentoring developers.
skill.summary: Master effective code review practices to provide constructive feedback, catch bugs early, and foste...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown guidance for code review practices. No executable code, network activity, or file system access is present. The content aligns perfectly with its stated purpose of teaching effective code review techniques.

content.user_title: Master code reviews with structured feedback techniques
content.value_statement: Code reviews often feel subjective and unhelpful. This skill provides a systematic approach with checklists, templates, and language-specific tips to deliver constructive, actionable feedback that improves code quality and team collaboration.
actual_capabilities: Provides a 4-phase review process from context gathering to decision
Supplies security, performance, and testing checklists for thorough reviews
Offers feedback phrasing patterns and severity labeling system
Includes language-specific review tips for Python and TypeScript
Provides PR review comment templates and best practices
limitations: Does not access repositories or analyze actual code without user input
Cannot execute tests or verify runtime behavior
Does not replace automated linters or security scanning tools
Requires user to provide code context for specific feedback

use_cases.title: Establish team review standards
use_cases.description: Create consistent review processes and quality expectations for development teams.

use_cases.title: Mentor through code reviews
use_cases.description: Provide educational feedback that teaches best practices without blocking progress.

use_cases.title: Strengthen security review rigor
use_cases.description: Use specialized checklists to identify vulnerabilities and security anti-patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code change and identify any bugs, security issues, or missing tests. Focus on the most important findings.

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security review focusing on input validation, authentication checks, and sensitive data handling. List any vulnerabilities found.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate the architectural design, scalability concerns, and alternative approaches. Provide specific recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Mentoring review
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide educational feedback that teaches concepts while being encouraging. Include both strengths and learning opportunities.

output_examples.input: Review this PR that adds user authentication to our API
output: Strengths: Clean separation of auth logic into middleware, comprehensive test coverage
Blocking: Missing rate limiting on login endpoint could enable brute force attacks
Important: Consider using bcrypt with higher work factor (12+) for password hashing
Suggestion: Extract JWT secret to environment variable instead of hardcoding
Praise: Good error messages that don't leak sensitive information

best_practices: Always start reviews by understanding the context and requirements
Use severity labels to help authors prioritize feedback
Balance critiques with specific praise for good practices
anti_patterns: Approving code without actually reviewing it
Blocking PRs for minor style preferences that linters can catch
Providing feedback without explaining the reasoning

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a text-based skill that works across all major AI assistant platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limitations?
faq.answer: It cannot access repositories or run tests. You must provide the code and context for review.

faq.question: Can it integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: No direct integration. Copy and paste PR details or code diffs to use the skill.

faq.question: Does it store or access my code?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the code you provide during the current session.

faq.question: How do I get more specific feedback?
faq.answer: Provide more context about the project, goals, and any specific concerns or risk areas.

faq.question: How does it compare to automated tools?
faq.answer: It complements linters and scanners by focusing on design, logic, and communication aspects.
